main event: A bright, round object was observed moving at a high speed and making a 90-degree turn in Bagdad, Florida in June 1954.
interesting points: The observation lasted for 1 hour., The object was seen 3-4 times during the observation period., The object appeared to be affected by atmospheric conditions., No aircraft were reported in the area during the sighting., The object was described as shiny and roughly three times larger than visible stars.
witness description: An aircraft mechanic in Crestview and a housewife in Bagdad.
